Tooltip.SceneDetect: Use PySceneDetect to automatically find scene changes in the video for splitting or batch processing.
Tooltip.SceneDetectThreshold: Adjust sensitivity for scene change detection. Lower values = more cuts; higher values = fewer cuts.
Tooltip.DetectScenesExtract: Run scene detection and automatically extract the detected scenes for further processing.
Tooltip.ModeSelect: Choose between single render mode (generate one 3D video) or batch mode (process multiple video + depth map pairs).
Tooltip.ApplyEntries: Apply the current Pop & Subject Controls values to update the preview and rendering parameters.
Tooltip.Model: Select a depth estimation model from Hugging Face. Larger models offer higher accuracy but require more VRAM and time.
Tooltip.OutputDirLabel: Displays the currently selected output folder where all generated depth maps and videos will be saved.
Tooltip.OutputDirButton: Open a dialog to select the folder where all processed results will be stored.
Tooltip.ColormapLabel: Choose a visual colormap to colorize the depth map (e.g., Viridis, Magma, Inferno).
Tooltip.ColormapDropdown: Applies the chosen colormap to visualize depth perception in preview and saved outputs.
Tooltip.InvertCheckbox: Flips near/far values in the depth map. Useful if the depth appears inverted.
Tooltip.SaveFramesCheckbox: Enable to save individual per-frame depth images in addition to the output video.
Tooltip.BatchSizeEntry: Set how many frames are processed per batch. Lower values reduce VRAM usage at the cost of speed.
Tooltip.ProcessImage: Processes a single image file to generate a depth map.
Tooltip.ProcessImageFolder: Processes all images in a selected folder using current depth settings.
Tooltip.ProcessVideo: Processes a video file to generate a full-depth map video.
Tooltip.ProcessVideoFolder: Processes all video files in a folder for batch depth generation.
Tooltip.InferenceSteps: Controls the number of steps the diffusion model uses to estimate depth. Higher values may improve quality but increase processing time.
Tooltip.CPUMode: Determines which parts of the model to offload to the CPU. Use 'sequential' for low VRAM systems to reduce GPU memory usage at the cost of speed.
Tooltip.StartButton: Begin generating a 3D side-by-side (SBS) or other formats using all current parameters.
Tooltip.PreviewButton: Preview the 3D output frame-by-frame to verify depth before and test settings before rendering.
Tooltip.SuspendButton: Temporarily pause the current 3D rendering process.
Tooltip.ResumeButton: Resume 3D rendering if it was previously paused.
Tooltip.CancelButton: Abort the 3D rendering process and discard in-progress output.
Tooltip.ResetButton: Reset all values and sliders back to default configuration.
Tooltip.OptionMenu: Choose your 3D output format. Includes SBS, Anaglyph, Interlaced, VR, and others.
Tooltip.AspectPreview: Displays a live preview of output resolution and aspect ratio based on current settings.
Tooltip.FGShift: Controls the perceived depth of foreground objects. Higher values make objects appear closer.
Tooltip.MGShift: Adjust the parallax for midground layers. Helps balance 3D across the scene depth.
Tooltip.BGShift: Sets depth offset for background regions. Negative values increase perceived distance.
Tooltip.Sharpness: Controls image sharpening after 3D warping. Negative values sharpen the image.
Tooltip.ZeroParallaxStrength: Controls the strength of zero-parallax alignment. Shifts the main subject toward screen depth to reduce eye strain and enhance stereo comfort.
Tooltip.ParallaxBalance: Balances screen depth between foreground and background emphasis.
Tooltip.MaxPixelShift: Limits maximum disparity between left and right images. Reduces ghosting in 3D.
Tooltip.DOFStrength: Controls the intensity of Depth of Field blur. Higher values simulate stronger focus falloff from the center depth plane.
Tooltip.ConvergenceStrength: Adds a stereo convergence offset to control the perceived screen-depth of the main subject. Higher values pull the left and right views inward, creating stronger pop-out effects.
Tooltip.EnableDynConvergence: Dynamically adjusts convergence strength based on subject depth. Helps maintain comfortable 3D viewing by aligning convergence to key focus areas automatically.
Tooltip.PreserveAspect: Keep the source video‚Äôs original aspect ratio in the final 3D output.
Tooltip.AutoCrop: Automatically removes black bars before 3D transformation to avoid artifacts.
Tooltip.SubjectTracking: Keeps key subjects centered at screen-depth for comfortable viewing.
Tooltip.FloatingWindow: Applies a dynamic floating window to reduce window violations in 3D projection.
Tooltip.EdgeMasking: Activates post-shift edge masking to reduce hard edge distortions.
Tooltip.Feathering: Feather the edges of the 3D mask for smoother visual transitions.
Tooltip.SkipBlankFrames: Skips blank/white frames from being rendered. Useful for cleaner cuts.
Tooltip.UseFFmpeg: Enable FFmpeg rendering for faster encoding. ‚ö†Ô∏è Requires FFmpeg in system PATH.
Tooltip.CRF: CRF controls CPU video quality: lower = better quality. 18‚Äì23 is visually lossless.
Tooltip.NVENCCQ: NVIDIA NVENC quality control. Similar to CRF but optimized for GPU encoding.
Tooltip.SelectedCodec: Standard codec used for CPU-based video export.
Tooltip.FFmpegCodec: Advanced encoder for FFmpeg export. NVENC is best for NVIDIA GPUs.
Tooltip.AspectRatio: Choose the final aspect ratio to match your target display or platform.
Tooltip.ExtractFrames: Extracts raw image frames from a video file for use with RIFE or ESRGAN processing.
Tooltip.RIFE: Enables AI interpolation to multiply frame rate for smooth slow motion or real-time upscaling.
Tooltip.ESRGAN: Uses Real-ESRGAN AI to upscale low-resolution frames with enhanced detail.
Tooltip.Resolution: Specifies the output resolution for the final rendered video (e.g., 1920x1080).
Tooltip.OriginalFPS: Input the source video‚Äôs native frame rate for accurate interpolation.
Tooltip.FPSMultiplier: Controls how many extra frames are generated between originals (e.g., 2x, 4x, 8x FPS).
Tooltip.AIBlend: Controls how much AI output is blended with the original. High values preserve more source texture.
Tooltip.InputResPct: Downscales input before upscaling to save memory or improve speed. 100% = full resolution.
Tooltip.ModelSelect: Choose an ESRGAN ONNX model. x2 = faster, x4 = sharper but slower.
Tooltip.PopGamma: Power curve for depth shaping. <1 adds near/mid pop; >1 flattens depth.
Tooltip.PopMid: Target depth for the subject after shaping (0=near, 1=far).
Tooltip.StretchLo: Low percentile used when stretching the depth range.
Tooltip.StretchHi: High percentile used when stretching the depth range.
Tooltip.SubjectLock: How strongly to lock zero-parallax to the detected subject.
Tooltip.Saturation: Adjust color intensity. >1 boosts vividness; <1 desaturates; 0 is grayscale.
Tooltip.Contrast: Expand or compress tonal range around mid-gray (0.5). Higher = punchier.
Tooltip.Brightness: Add/subtract overall lightness after contrast. Use small steps (¬±0.05).
Tooltip.IPDShift: Adjusts the interpupillary distance multiplier to exaggerate or reduce stereo separation.
Tooltip.EnableIPD: Enable or disable IPD-based stereo scaling. When off, value is ignored (0.0).
Tooltip.AddVideo: Add a video file to the batch processing list.
Tooltip.AddDepthMap: Add a corresponding depth map file to the batch processing list.
Tooltip.StartBatchRender: Begin rendering all video + depth map pairs in the batch list using the current 3D settings.
Tooltip.ColorResetButton: Reset all color grading adjustments (saturation, contrast, brightness, etc.) back to defaults.
